header.title: Tackling antisemitism in Manchester: 'We are feeling more and more unsafe'
header.subtitle: NA
header.postText: Fighting between Israelis and Palestinians in Gaza and a wave of antisemitic attacks across Europe coincided with a surge in assaults on Jewish targets in the UK. Phoebe Greenwood visits Prestwich in Manchester – home to the second largest Jewish community in the UK – to find out what people feel is fuelling antisemitism and what might be done to stop it. . commentThread.commentText: Never Again.

Wow. I found this so enlightening. I can see how being Jewish and exposed to anti-Semitism is so similar to being Muslim and exposed to Islamophobia, especially when you see  how such oppression can be fueled by the spread of propaganda which unfairly generalizes the extreme, violent behaviour of a few to that of an entire cultural group; be it conflating the actions of Isis to all Muslims, or the actions of the Israeli government to that of all Jewish people. I have to admit, I did not expect to see school kids internalizing their oppression; frightened because they truly believed the propaganda, that they were at risk of anti-semitic attacks from anyone who criticized the policies of the Israeli government. That was so sad. But, thank goodness the Guardian continues to explore and help us understand such complex issues. Very few of the other major media outlets make such efforts. As such, I truly believe that The Guardian is one our strongest and most effective tools in the fight to address anti-Semitism and all other forms of prejudice and discrimination around the world today
